10023.description: Ballet For All Kids is a non-profit organization whose mission is to give every child, regardless of their abilities or disabilities, the opportunity to reap the benefits of a classical ballet education. We depend on the community to volunteer and help make a difference in the lives of kids with special needs. Come and assist students as they learn ballet technique. All volunteers must be passionate about our mission and comfortable working with children. No dance experience necessary. Consistent weekly volunteers preferred, but one-time help is also greatly appreciated! We hold classes Saturdays and Sundays in various locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens as well as New Jersey. Please check our website for our current class schedule: https://www.balletforallkids.com/classes/ If you are interesting, please contact us to let us know which class you would like to join and when you would be able to start volunteering with us! We would also love to learn a bit more about you and why you would like to volunteer. Contact us today for more information.
10023.title: Dance class for kids with disabilities - UWS, Manhattan

10023.description: This opportunity is available every night! Help rescue excess pastries, salads, and sandwiches from a Lincoln Center bakery! These leftover goods will be delivered to Next Step Men's Shelter, located at 30 W 68th St, New York, NY 10023. Medium weight: the average amount of food rescued is 30-50 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10023.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Upper West Side 9:30PM

10023.description: Do you enjoy making a difference with fun and interesting conversations, and helping foreign born students over a cup of coffee or chocolate? Your unique collection of life experiences can make a tremendous impact on the lives of young people new to America. As a Table Wisdom mentor, you’ll have the chance to cultivate invaluable relationships while helping foreign born students and young professionals with their career prospects and practice their English language skills. It's as easy as signing up, getting paired, and starting a conversation. To join us, you must Be a native (or fluent) English language speaker Preferably 50+ yr old. But if not, then we ask that you have >3 years of professional work experience Have a Bachelor’s Degree or higher & know how to video-chat (Skype, FaceTime, or a similar program) Have 55 minutes per week, and willing to work with time zone difference of your mentee After four weeks, you can decide if you would like to continue. If not, then simply let us know and we'll take care of the rest! Our pairs talk about everything: from sports and culture to industry-specific skills and knowledge, what you discuss is up to you and your mentee. We make matches based on the student needs to help mentors provide the most value possible. Some of the mentees in the past have attended U.S. schools like the University of Southern California and Washington University in St. Louis. By having fun yet meaningful conversations you will help students improve their lives by helping them prepare for their career, learning about American culture, building their confidence and fluency in English. All you need is the ability to video chat, the desire to meet someone new and to have fun talking! (Oh, and don't forget your cup of coffee or chocolate!) Help a young foreign born person improve their quality of life in America. Join Table Wisdom Now: https://www.table-wisdom.org/join-us Frequently Asked Questions: https://www.table-wisdom.org/contact-us-faqs \"Although our lives are so different and perhaps distant, it is encouraging that there is so much that we share trying to be our best selves and making this a better world.\" -- Alan, mentor \"I feel so blessed to have met my excellent English language mentor. He always encourages me to speak out and taught me some idiomatic English which I didn't learn from a textbook.\" -- Zachary, mentee
10023.title: Share your experience! Mentor foreign born students and young professionals

10023.description: Teens for Food Justice works to ensure universal equitable access to healthy, fresh, affordable food. We train youth in 21st century hydroponic urban agriculture techniques, entrepreneurship, and health/nutrition education and advocacy, empowering them as change agents who can lead themselves and their own food insecure communities towards healthier futures. We’re seeking an experienced photographer to help us capture high-quality photos of our program at work and the communities we serve. Photographing our program is a fun opportunity to check out some cutting-edge indoor farming technology and interact with a bright, enthusiastic group of students! To learn more about us, visit Teensforfoodjustice.org. Requirements : * Prior photography experience and your own, high-quality camera * A linkable portfolio with up-to-date examples of your work * Comfort working around and interacting with children (6th - 12th graders) If you’re interested in joining us or would like to learn more, please email Joshua Serrano at jserrano@teensforfoodjustice.org with a brief description of your availability and a link to your portfolio. We look forward to hearing from you!
10023.title: Photographer Needed for Community Events and After School Programming
10023.org: Teens for Food Justice, powered by Students for Service

10020.description: December 11, 6:00-7:30pm Prepare pampering kits for grandmothers in our Kinship Care program who are raising their grandchildren, so they can practice self-care.
10020.title: Give caregivers a day of relaxation
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

11220.description: Welcome to D&A! We are a charity school based in China and we are looking for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
11220.title: Paid Teaching Role for Charity School - Learn to Teach, Travel China and Make a Difference

11220.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. Womankind's Brooklyn Community Office holds monthly Movies and Communitiesevent open to the community on the last Friday of every month. After a movie screening, a discussion group is held for viewers to share their thoughts and reflect on the film. We are seeking volunteers who can provide Mandarin interpretation during the event. The volunteer would be present throughout the duration of the screening and especially active during the discussion group. Dates: 7/27/18, 8/31/18, 9/28/18. 10/26/18, 11/30/18, 12/21/18 Time: 4-7pm Please email volunteer@iamwk.org with the subject \"Spanish interpreter\" if interested.
11220.title: Mandarin Interpreter

11220.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. We are seeking a volunteer who can provide Creole interpretation for our clients. The volunteer must have availability between Mondays - Wednesdays from 10am - 4pm. Sessions are typically an hour long, once a week. Interpretation can be provided in person or over the phone.
11220.title: Creole Interpreter

10036.description: Volunteer teachers are needed for our TASC (formerly \"GED\") classes. These classes meet on Tuesdays and Thursdays (other time slots will become available later in the fall as the program is expanded). We teach all five subjects that comprise the exam, with the majority of classroom time devoted to the two main subjects: Reading comprehension (Tuesdays) and Math (Thursdays). Each TASC class meets from 6-7:30pm to cover the main subjects, with an additional half-hour (7:30-8pm) allotted for instruction in the other subject areas, as well as tutoring individual students. While some of our volunteers work with us more than one day a week, we ask for a minimum time commitment of a single evening session. Prior teaching experience is a plus. For those who have a passion for teaching but lack formal experience, we provide training as well as a mentoring program, which pairs less experienced volunteers with more experienced ones. Note: The location where we teach our TASC classes is at 459 W 46th Street, but a new volunteer's first visit and subsequent orientation will take place at our main building (located nearby at 422 West 57th St). Together One New York is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to immigrants, as well adult education programs for all members of the NYC community. In addition to our TASC classes, resources include language classes, a citizenship program, and English conversation classes. With your help, we can expand our outreach and increase the number of people served. Thank you for considering us! For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10036.title: Volunteer Teacher for Adult High School Equivalency Program

10036.description: ABOUT THE MENTORSHIP As a High School or College Access Mentor you will guide the success of BTNY High School students by supporting them through a year of high school, helping them to prepare for success in a 4-year college. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE... Mentor a core group of 12-15 1high school students in a specific grade level. Ensure that your students meet organizational expectations, including: 85% or above in each academic class Participation in at least two extracurricular activities Attendance to all six Super Saturdays (and Seminars if in 9 th or 10 th grades) College Access Mentors only: Apply to at least 12 best fit colleges (including at least 1 SUNY and 1 CUNY school) College Access Mentors only: Submit all financial aid applications College Access Mentors only: Apply to at least 5 scholarships Conduct monthly check-ins by phone or video chat with a core group of 12-15 students, and report the information gathered during those meetings in a timely fashion Work onsite during six Saturdays throughout the academic year with other HSMs, High School Coordinators and High School Director Plan and co-teach grade level college readiness workshops for a small class of high school students with another Mentor Complete 24+ hours of training and at least four hours of professional development during the year Receiving feedback constructively in order to improve performance Tracking and reporting student data Other duties based on the grade level you are assigned WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO... Can demonstrate experience and results with similar responsibilities to those listed above Is passionate about forming mentoring relationships with students Is passionate about supporting low-income, high-achieving students to earn admission to selective 4-year colleges Is a current college student, graduate student, or recent college graduate based in the New York City area during the academic year Maintains / maintained at least a 3.0 GPA Will respond to email, phone calls, and texts from students and staff within 24 hours Can commit to the entire 2018-19 academic year Is confident with MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint in particular), Google Suite, and comfortable learning new systems. Experience with Salesforce or other databases a plus. HIGH SCHOOL/COLLEGE ACCESS MENTOR TENTATIVE CALENDAR... Late August/ Early September - three full days of High School Mentor Training. Mentors can choose either August 17-19 or August 24-26. High School Curriculum Night: August 29. Tentative Professional Development Dates (Mentors should choose at least two to attend) September 12/13 October 16/17 February 20/21 April 23/24 Tentative Super Saturday Dates: September 22 November 10 December 15 February 9 March 23 May 11 Between Super Saturdays: Remotely check in with each of your 12-15 students Plan your lesson for the upcoming Super Saturday Check-in Meeting with assigned High School Coordinator Attend Professional Development Meeting with all HSMs and High School Coordinators June - Complete Mentorship ANTICIPATED TIME COMMITMENT... This mentorship requires approximately 145-160 hours throughout the academic year, including: 24 hours of internship training - August/ September 50 hours of Saturday Programming -6 Saturdays throughout the academic year, 7am-4pm 100 hours of student check-ins - 30 minute check-ins with each student within your cohort of 12-13 following each of the 6 Saturday programs, plus a half hour to report data gathered from each series of check-in’s 12 hours of pre-Saturday lesson planning - About 2 hours of lesson planning per Saturday program 10 hours of professional development support - 1 hour meeting with assigned High School Coordinator between each Saturday program, plus two two-hour sessions chosen by the HSM 2 hours to attend the Fall Curriculum Night 2 hours to attend one night of Seminar (only 9th and 10th grade mentors) COMPENSATION BTNY is strongly believes in selecting the top, qualified candidates. As a part of your offer you can expect to receive the following: A base stipend of $1,750 (High School Mentors - 9th to 11th grade) or $2,250 (College Access Mentors - 12th grade) Candidates can also choose to volunteer their time A pre-paid MetroCard card to cover internship related travel expenses Ongoing professional development support, including PD focused meetings and letters of recommendation TO APPLY Complete the High School Mentor application online (https://tinyurl.com/BTNYMentor2018) by Sunday, July 22 nd at 11:59PM and indicate your interest in CAM where prompted. This application also includes: Resume Current or Most Recent College Transcript (if available) Recommendation Form ( link shared through application, can be completed through August 5 th) If you have any questions, please e-mail seasonal@btny.org
10036.title: Mentor NYC Students!

10036.description: International Sports and Music Project (ISMP) and Covenant House New York (CHNY) are looking for volunteers! About ISMP: ISMP creates sports and music opportunities as a means of connecting and empowering children in vulnerable communities around the world. About CHNY: As the largest provider of runaway and homeless youth services in New York City, nearly 250 teens seek shelter at CHNY on any given night. ISMP and CHNY Partnership: ISMP and CHNY have partnered to offer guitar lessons and basketball clinics for any homeless teen who wishes to participate. When: Tuesdays 7:00 PM-9:00 PM (one-hour guitar lesson, one-hour jam session) Wednesdays 7:00 PM-9:00 PM (basketball drills and pick-up games) Where: Covenant House New York 460 W. 41 st, New York, NY 10036 Volunteer Expectations: Music volunteers should have experience playing guitar or other instruments Experience teaching music encouraged, but not required Basketball volunteers should have a strong understanding of the sport Must be comfortable with the organization and facilitation of basketball drills and games The ideal volunteer is passionate about sports and/or music, patient, sensitive, mindful, and comfortable with encouraging participation and inclusion Volunteers should expect to attend a one-time mandatory training session, complete a mandatory one-hour online training session, along with participating in three volunteer sessions per month All interested candidates should contact Michael at volunteers@ismproject.org. We look forward to hearing from you!
10036.title: Sports and Music Volunteer

10036.description: Do you love to teach? Do you want to empower older adults in NYC! Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment (RISE) taps into the energy and momentum of aging by empowering older adults with information on rights, resources, and key policy changes so they can thrive. Our RISE Advocates work to achieve this mission by leading workshops to senior groups on a variety of aging issues including consumer protection, financial fitness and senior scams. We are looking for bilingual speakers to help us with this project, so if you speak Spanish, we would love to have you join the team! Attend our upcoming Training October 25 and start volunteering! For more information or to sign up, reach out to Victoria, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Become a RISE Advocate! (Spanish speakers)

10036.description: We are updating SHARE's Breast Cancer Helpline Resource Guide. This very important guide is used internally by Helpline volunteers to assist cancer patients who call SHARE for guidance emotionally, medically, financially, physically, transportation-wise, etc., to name just a few. This project involves making phonecalls, updating database entries, sending emails, and keeping a spreadsheet. We need volunteers who can work in our office any time between 9:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.
10036.title: Update SHARE Cancer Support's Resource Guide

10036.description: We are looking for a volunteer to help us with tasks related to our upcoming Hope Gala. Our annual Hope Gala will be held on October 17th at Guastavino's. Held annually, the dinner and dance promises to be an unforgettable night marking the celebration of the Foundation's achievements in fighting leukemia and other diseases treatable by bone marrow transplants. We are looking for a volunteer who can work remotely to help us with our Silent Auction portion of the event. Tasks would include: filling out silent auction item request forms, looking into businesses who offer a silent auction donation items, sending letters to businesses requesting items, working with the Development & Events staff and Gala Planning Committee to execute such tasks, and assisting with mailings. This role can be done from home at your best convenience with the option of coming into our NYC office. If you are interested please reach our to Renee, Development and Events Assistant at renee@icla.org
10036.title: Volunteer needed to help with pre-Gala planning

10036.description: Many seniors are disconnected from the vital resources in their own communities. Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment (RISE) works to combat this! We want every senior to feel empowered to access and utilize all the senior services that NYC has to offer. By offering workshops to senior groups on a variety of topics like financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams, we continue to empower seniors to live their best years! Want to get involved? Get Trained with us! No prior knowledge on these aging issues? No problem! LiveOn NY will provide comprehensive training to all interested volunteers. Elder Abuse & Consumer Protection Volunteer Training Date: Tuesday, August 14 Maximizing Your Financial Resources Volunteer Training Date: Wednesday, August 15 WHAT WOULD YOU DO AS A VOLUNTEER? Volunteers give workshops to seniors groups and caregivers on aging issues including financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams! Our workshops are hosted all over the five boroughs of New York City. WHAT IS YOUR TIME COMMITMENT? You can create your own volunteer schedule! Volunteers select a minimum of 2-3 events per month. To get involved or to register for the next trainings, contact Victoria Thornton 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org
10036.title: Get Training to Empower Seniors all over NYC!

10036.description: RISE (Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment) taps into the energy and momentum of aging by empowering older adults with information on rights, resources, and key policy changes so they can thrive. WHAT WOULD YOU DO? We are looking for volunteers to help us with our outreach and advocacy! Volunteers will be trained to lead workshops to groups of older adults on a variety of aging issues, including senior scams, financial fitness, and activism! LiveOn NY will provide comprehensive training to all interested volunteers! Volunteer Orientation coming soon Tuesday, October 16! To get involved or register for the next orientation, contact Victoria 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org
10036.title: Volunteer Advocate!

10036.description: Nearly 1 in 3 older New Yorkers live with the painful, daily choice between food, medicine, and rent. Our Benefits Outreach Center works to ensure they do not have to make this choice by providing screening and application assistance for various public benefits. WE ARE LOOKING FOR A SPANISH SPEAKER TO JOIN OUR TEAM! WHAT WILL YOU DO? Volunteers will help us screen seniors to determine their eligibility for SNAP, SCRIE/DRIE, Medicaid and other public benefits. You will work primarily with non/limited English speaking clients to provide benefits assistance and screening. THE IDEAL VOLUNTEER... The ideal volunteer would be fluent in Spanish, have excellent communication skills, and be comfortable working with older adults over the phone. TIME COMMITMENT AND TRAINING! 2-3 days/week Our Benefits team will provide ALL necessary training and ongoing support to you! To learn more or to apply, contact Victoria Thornton, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Work To End Hunger for NYC Seniors!

10036.description: At LiveOn NY, we work to ensure low income older adults in NYC do not have to choose between food and other living expenses. Our Benefits Outreach Center screens older adults for public benefits eligibility and assists them throughout the entire application process. We are looking for a Spanish speaker to join our team! SOME OF YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE... Screen older adults to determine eligibility for SNAP, SCRIE/DRIE, Medicaid and other public benefits Work primarily with non/limited English speaking clients to provide benefits assistance and screening Assist clients in completing applications Work directly with Benefits Program Manager and Senior Client Service Coordinator to follow-up with clients and report cases in the database Attend monthly/quarterly meeting with Benefits team THE IDEAL VOLUNTEER... The ideal volunteer would be fluent in Spanish, have prior knowledge of the SNAP and Medicaid programs, have excellent communication skills, and be comfortable working with older adults over the phone. YOUR TIME COMMITMENT WILL BE... 3 days/week RECEIVE TRAINING AND SUPPORT! The Benefits Program Manager and Senior Service Client Coordinator will provide all necessary training and ongoing support to you. BENEFITS FOR VOLUNTEERING WITH US... You will become a valued member of the LiveOn NY Benefits Outreach Center and work to ensure low income older adults has access to vital public benefits. Work towards LiveOn NY’s mission and vision, to make NYC a better place to age. To learn more or to apply, contact Victoria Thornton, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Benefits Specialist - Spanish Speaker

10036.description: The Children's Institute of Fashion Arts is looking for seasoned fundraisers interested in organizational development, fundraising, and programming.
10036.title: Seeking volunteers committed to our mission for fundraising and events.
10036.org: CHILDRENS INSTITUTE OF FASHION ARTS INC

10036.description: Do you want to transform the lives of youth and poor communities using the developmental power of performance? Everyday at All Stars, we help young people develop both on stage and off. We do this through six programs, including the All Stars Talent Show Network and the Development School for Youth. Our volunteers come from various professions and personal backgrounds - but what they have in common is the belief that all people should develop in their lives. Our programs enable this, and our people make it possible.
10036.title: Development and Performance for Young People!

10036.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from an office in Midtown West! We will deliver the food to Travelers Hotel, located at 274 W 40th street. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-45 pounds.
10036.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 3PM!

10036.description: Go the extra mile with Back on My Feet NYC! Dedicated teams of volunteers run 2-4 miles with our members who are transitioning out of homelessness. We encourage runners of all speeds (run/jog/walk) to become a part of our community! Team Times Square runs with the veterans of Samaritan Village on W 43rd Street in between 8th & 9th Avenues every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 5:30-6:30AM. To find out more and sign up for an orientation, visit nyc.backonmyfeet.org/nyc-run-with-us
10036.title: Midtown Morning Runner

10036.description: Come join us as we educate children about healthy eating, food and taste. What do Volunteers do? Volunteers are an essential component of the work that we do with children, helping out in the classroom but also providing a mentoring role for children. After participating in a hands on training, volunteers are partnered with a Spoons Across America Educator and assist in all aspects of program implementation. We look for an ongoing commitment between volunteers and a particular classroom or school, yet can also accommodate one-time volunteers. Volunteer responsibilities include assisting with program set up, working directly with children, teaching cooking skills, and assisting in the kitchen where appropriate. We are looking for individuals enthusiastic about healthy eating and children’s programming to join us! When and where are your programs? We teach programs for school children across the NYC boroughs. Programs occur throughout the school year and there are opportunities for an extended commitment as well as one-time opportunities. Will I be trained? All volunteers receive training at the Spoons Across America offices (630 Ninth Ave @ 44th St in Manhattan), and are required to attend one of the following training dates: Monday October 2nd: 5:30-7:00 Wednesday, October 4th: 12:00-1:30 What programs do you have? We have a number of on-going programs for school age children in New York City. See our website www.spoonsacrossamerica.org for details. I'm ready to go! How do I sign up? If you are interested in volunteering with Spoons Across America this year. Please contact Ali McDowell, Director of Programs and Partnerships, at ali@spoonsacrossamerica.org. In your email, please indicate the following: - Training session you will attend: Monday 10/22: 5:30- 7:00 or Wednesday 10/24: 12:00-1:30 * Please note: Volunteers must complete a background check prior to the program date I want to volunteer, but I am not available right now. Will there be other opportunities to get involved? Definitely! If you are unable to volunteer at this point, we will have other opportunities available this winter and spring. If possible, please attend one of the trainings in October. Programs are ongoing and once you are trained you will be able to volunteer. Additional trainings will be held later this year. I want to volunteer, but I can’t attend the training.Will there be other trainings? Depending upon need and availability, additional trainings may be scheduled this fall. Please contact Ali with your availability. * Do you work for a business or company that wants to make a volunteer commitment? We can schedule a special training sessions for groups of 10 or more people, onsite or at our offices. Contact Ali for more information.
10036.title: Volunteer as a Food Educator in NYC Elementary Classrooms- Trainings in October
10036.org: From Farm to Table d/b/a Spoons Across America

10036.description: Volunteer and support arts and social justice events and performances.
10036.title: Volunteer with Theatre of the Oppressed NYC

10036.description: Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana, an internationally known flamenco and Spanish dance company is seeking an Intern for 2015. Position Summary: Internship Program Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana is seeking a current college student, graduate student, or recent college graduate interested in serving as an Intern and providing a wide range of database, research, administrative, and general support to the FVCS administrative team. In return, FVCS will provide an opportunity for the intern to gain experience in and familiarity with areas such as programming, arts in education, marketing and media outreach, fundraising, philanthropy, international development, and the day-to-day operations of a nonprofit organization with a global reach. Minimum commitment requirements vary, however the general term is 6 months for NY residents and on a case-by-case basis for international students. 10 - 15 hours per week is requested depending on the duration of the Internship in exchange for free classes, occasional free workshops and studio time. Internship areas of focus include: Development: The Development Intern assists the Executive and Managing Directors with tasks that vary by season (including support for grant deadlines, end-of-year giving, gala, Artist Advisory Council and Board) and is responsible for entering donations into the database, assisting with program tracking, taking minutes at various meetings and grant/artist opportunity research. Additionally, the ideal candidate possesses a strong interest in engaging Flamenco, contemporary and experimental dance and/or performance work. Experience with Mac software, Word, Excel, and Patronmanager are strongly encouraged. Programming: The Programming Intern works closely with the Programs and Events Coordinator to organize many of the artist programs and events including, but not limited to: the annual FERIA, our Spring Performance Season, arts-in-education residencies, Certamen and our application based programs. Candidates should have experience with Microsoft Excel and Word, excellent writing skills, strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a small, busy office environment. Knowledge of PatronManager and Google Docs not required but helpful. Marketing: The Marketing Intern assists the with the social media accounts, press and promotional materials, website maintenance and online class listings. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, basic organizational skills, and an interest in engaging in Flamenco and other dance classes and events. Attention to detail and strong proofreading skills are a priority. Experience with Patronmanager, Facebook Business Manager, and other media software a plus, in addition to a strong knowledge of social media platforms such as Facebook,Twitter, and Instagram. Media: The Media Intern assists with the video archive and database, press and promotional materials, website maintenance and social media. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, organizational skills, and an interest in the documentation of Flamenco, contemporary, and experimental dance. Experience with Mac software and Excel are strongly encouraged. Experience with, iMovie, Final Cut Pro X, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator and/or social media platforms a plus. Responsibilities include: Answering phones and providing information Taking rental and class payments Running errands Assisting with bulk mailings Helping maintain operations and facilities Customer Care Greeting guests in a warm, enthusiastic and helpful manner Working as a team with the staff and other interns to provide outstanding and consistent customer service Enforcing all policies and procedures for use of the spaces: be fair and firm Awareness at all times of what is happening in the studios Providing formal or informal orientations and answering questions for new visitors Providing immediate and thoughtful responses to customer requests Being responsive and pro-active in meeting renters’ needs Accommodating the creative needs of clients through operational solutions that safeguard and protect the space Assisting in the maintenance of a robust client database by capturing relevant details such as customer preferences and referral sources Facilities Management Assisting with facility operations and maintenance Implementing maintenance timetables and checklists Establishing and enforcing basic \"set up\" for each studio Ensuring standard inventory of products, equipment and supplies Conducting Rounds, Runs and Routines at specified intervals Assisting in the maintenance of strong relationships with location’s building staff Requirements Applicants must commit to 15 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Exceptions may be made for academic credit. Must be proficient in a Mac environment Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, social networking sites, Photoshop, and Illustrator a must Video editing skills using Final Cut Pro, iMovie etc. Excellent writing skills Priority will be given to those with experience in dance administration who are pursuing or have completed their college education Benefits Invaluable knowledge and experience working in a top Flamenco Company Connections and relationships with the local and international dance community unlimited Flamenco Vivo classes and access to discounted and free rehearsal space for their own artistic exploration. Personal recommendation letters To apply, please submit your dance and administrative resume along with your cover letter, three references, a sample of edited photo or video, and a writing sample. Once applications are screened, an interview will be scheduled.Flamenco Vivo is committed to supporting and valuing the great diversity of our multicultural city and dance field. People of color are encouraged to apply.
10036.title: Arts Administration Internship with Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana

10036.description: Supervisor: Helpline Manager Position Summary: Information and Referral Helpline volunteers will offer information and treatment options to callers and answer basic questions regarding body image and eating disorders in a caring and compassionate manner. This position is a great learning opportunity and involves a minimum of 15 hours of training. Primary Responsibilities: 1. Information and Referral Services: Provide positive, respectful and timely responses regarding eating disorder information requests via incoming phone calls, voicemail messages, emails, forums, instant messages, and social media sites under Helpline responsibility. Ensure the distribution of Helpline information and treatment options in a timely manner that fits the needs of the individual and is presented in a professional manner. Compose general letters of response for information requests. Develop skills related to database management. Increase knowledge and understanding concerning eating disorders and how to appropriately support those affected by them. When deemed appropriate by the Helpline Supervisor, serve as a mentor in the training of newer Helpline volunteers and interns. Contribute to the association’s mission of eliminating eating disorders and body dissatisfaction. 2. Program Duties: Assist Program department staff with ongoing educational and outreach projects. Required Qualifications: High energy, positive attitude, and enthusiasm. Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills. Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to provide quality customer service. Strong computer skills, data entry and word-processing ability. Must be dependable and self-motivated. Able to work effectively as an individual and as part of a team. Recovery is important to us here at NEDA. We require that applicants with personal experience who are interested in getting involved with the National Eating Disorders Association have two years of strong recovery due to the intense and triggering nature of this position.
10036.title: Helpline Volunteer/Intern

10036.description: Lar Lubovitch and the Board of Directors are pleased to invite you to join the newly formed Junior Board of the Lar Lubovitch Dance Company. Membership on the Junior Board offers a unique opportunity to personally participate in the organization of this prestigious New York dance company. A short list of the benefits includes the following: -Invitations to special junior board member events throughout the year. -Attendance at private rehearsals with dancers and choreographer. -Access to a backstage experience and a chance to meet the dancers. -Acknowledgement and listed by name in all printed programs. -Priority seating for friends purchasing Gala tickets. -Involvement in the planning and staging of dance events To join the Junior Board, each member undertakes the responsibility of a $250 membership per year plus the commitment of selling 5 Gala tickets to the company’s principal event of the season.
10036.title: Seeking Junior Board Members

10036.description: UX is a development institution that is forward thinking, free of cost, and open to people of all ages. It is a new crossroads for learning. The whole city is its campus. It takes place at the All Stars Project headquarters on 42nd St. and it also takes place in corporate boadrooms and back stage at Broadway theatres, in your neighborhood and at your school, even in your living room if you want it to. It has no tuition and no grades. We are looking for mature adults of all ages, open-minded thinkers, self-starters with organization and planning skills. Good oral and written communication skills. Administrative skills; including but not limited to: Microsoft Suite & Database management. Willingness to travel throughout N.Y.C.'s five boroughs. Some evening and weekend availability a plus.
10036.title: UX - Volunteer

10036.description: Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana We believe that the universal spirit of flamenco, a multicultural art form, has the power to build bridges between cultures. Artistic Director Carlota Santana leads this company of energetic dancers and musicians in: powerful performances extensive community outreach Volunteers: Work- Study Program Flamenco Vivo’s Work- Study program provides students with the opportunity to work in exchange for free Flamenco Vivo classes and studio rental. Duties include customer service such as checking-in students, handling cash payments and maintaining student records, as well as general office work such as cleaning, relaying messages and providing basic information to the public. Cleaning or maintenance duties require late and early hours of work. Requirements Applicants must reside in NYC and commit to a minimum of 3 months Proficiency in English (Spanish a plus) Prior experience in customer service a must Excellent organizational skills and the ability to multitask with detailed accuracy in a fast-paced environment Proficiency in a Mac and PC environment with Microsoft Word and Excel Benefits Students working a minimum of 6 hours per week will receive a class card for every 3 hours worked.
10036.title: Flamenco Vivo Work/Study Program

10036.description: Youth Onstage! offers young people, ages 14 to 21, the opportunity to perform in and create plays that have something to say about the world and its future. During its first four years, YO! has produced hip-hop cabarets, poetry snaps, and plays by first-time youth writers. All productions are performance experiments, designed to challenge its performers and audiences to think and feel outside of the box. They tackle difficult social and political issues and create an environment in which contemporary urban youth can express their experiences and perspectives to a diverse audience of adults and youth from New York City and beyond. Young people can get involved in YO! by applying to the free after-school performance training program, an integrated course of intensive performance classes volunteer teachers with pofessional theater training. Theater professionals are needed to teach various improvisation and technical classes during the Fall, Spring, or Summer. The Fall and Spring schedule is a ten week program that meets once a week for 90 minute classes. The Summer program runs four times a week for 60 minute classes. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=81rqVwzzcbs&feature=channel
10036.title: Youth Onstage Faculty

10036.description: The Marketing, Sales and Public Relations Department is seeking various interns to work with and be trained by Gail Peck, the Sales Director of the All Stars, Inc. This department works closely with the Castillo Theater, the dynamic home of cutting- edge improvisational, black, social, political, and avant-garde theater that features the work of playwrights from Germany and Martinique as well as Bed- Stuy and the Bronx. Responsibilities: sending out press releases and inviting the press for shows, database up-keep and entry, making sales calls to theater patrons, internet research to make new connections, PR (putting together lists of PR outlets/magazines), etc.
10036.title: Marketing and Sales Intern/ Volunteer

10036.description: The Office of the President is currently recruiting six interns for Fall 2008. Interns will gain valuable hands- on experience in the non- profit sector and will have the opportunity to work with a variety of community organizers and philanthropists. Responsibilities: track the president's written correspondence, produce Board of Directors' meetings, organize special events, maintain large donor databases/files, answer president's telephone line, etc.
10036.title: Intern for the Office of the President

10036.description: Work with our dynamic Sales and Marketing Director to promote a variety of All Stars productions -- from Hip-Hop Cabarets to avante garde drama to community open houses. Work includes targeting various constituencies through online media and phone outreach. Creative ideas and campaigns are welcomed. Day time hours are best.
10036.title: Volunteer Theatre Sales Support

10036.description: The Lar Lubovitch Dance Company is world-renowned. We currently have 14 dedicated members on our Senior Board, and we are now seeking to add 3 or 4 more lovers of dance to our circle of supporters. Prospective board members should have an appreciation of dance and be willing to work with other like-minded professionals, helping the company realize its mission. The commitment of time and money are both very reasonable -- while the emotional and spiritual rewards are enormous. We would be very happy to meet with you and let you see what we are all about. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.
10036.title: Seeking Senior Board Members

10036.description: Looking for caring adults to volunteer to support an innovative performance and development program that involves more than 10,000 young people in New York City each year. In the \"All Stars Talent Show,\" every young person who auditions makes it into the show. Adult and youth volunteers work together to conduct community outreach and help produce auditions, workshops and shows. Our \"Center for Youth Development\" on West 42nd Street is the producing headquarters for these off-site productions, which take place in inner-city communities throughout New York City.
10036.title: Inner-City Youth Talent Show Support Staff

10036.description: Castillo Theatre Production Volunteer - A showplace for the plays of Fred Newman and Heiner Muller, a multicultural home for Black theatre, and a hotbed of theatrical improvisation, Castillo includes people of all ages and backgrounds in its creative life. Embarking on its 32nd season, The award winning Castillo Theater brings socially relevant theatre, dealing with contemporary and historical social issues to the heart of New York's commercial theatre district. Volunteers are needed to support all aspects of the theatre. marketing and sales,set design, costumes, wardrobe, lighting, sound, stage management, box office, house staff,theatre administration, audience development, and much more! Most positions will train. Schedules are varied and flexible; however, for some technical positions in the theatre a stable, reliable schedule is essential. Some evening and weekend availability needed.
10036.title: Castillo Theatre Production Volunteer

08835.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08835.title: Manville, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08836.description: Help provide emergency first aid, rescue, and transport services to those in need in Martinsville and the Washington Valley section of Bridgewater. A great way to learn about emergency services and healthcare while helping others in your community during their time of greatest need. Volunteer for either daytime or nighttime service. We will provide you with all necessary training, mentoring, and equipment at no cost to you. Applicants must be at least 18 years old. Please call 732-469-1505 or e-mail us at mrsquad@verizon.net for more information.
08836.title: Ambulance Driver

08836.description: Help provide emergency first aid, rescue, and transport services to those in need in Martinsville and the Washington Valley section of Bridgewater. A great way to learn about emergency services and healthcare while helping others in your community during their time of greatest need. Volunteer for either daytime or nighttime service. We will provide you with all necessary training, mentoring, and equipment at no cost to you. Applicants must be at least 18 years old. Please call 732-469-1505 or e-mail us at mrsquad@verizon.net for more information.
08836.title: EMT

08837.title: Facilitator for LGBTQ+ group for people with disabilities

08837.title: Field Volunteers

08837.description: JANJ is looking for an eager volunteer to perform administrative duties to assist our staff in our Edison office. Responsibilities include: -entering data into our system -copying and organizing event paperwork -mailing documents -ordering food for events -assisting wherever needed Qualifications: -computer literacy -tech savvy -organized
08837.title: Our Programs team needs an administrative assistant who loves to type!

08837.description: JANJ is looking for an eager volunteer to assist our program managers in running our High School Heroes and corporate events. Responsibilities include: -travelling to JANJ events -pairing volunteers with classes -organizing lunch for volunteers -taking photos and gathering quotes for our social media accounts -addressing volunteer inquiries Qualifications: -organized -a passion for interacting with elementary, middle, and high schoolers -knowledge of social media platforms -tech savvy
08837.title: Volunteer Program Associate

08837.description: We are a non-profit looking for positive-minded adult volunteers of all ages to help with various data-entry projects for our growing organization. The hours are flexible - come when you can, stay as long as you like - just let us know. We need talents of all types from data entry savvy volunteers to research and development and everything in between. Join us in our exciting new Education Center in Raritan Center Business Park in Edison and meet our wonderful staff who are dedicated to our mission of empowering young people to own their economic success. Learn more about us at www.janj.org
08837.title: Do you like to type? Data Entry help needed for local education nonprofit

08837.description: Looking for Veterans who wish to Volunteer to visit/companionship with Veterans who are currently on Caring Hospice service.
08837.title: Veteran Volunteers

08837.description: Participate in activities such as: Companionship/Patient Visits, Talent Sharing Patient Visits - play music, work on art projects, Helping Hands patient Visits - grocery shop, relieve caregiver and Office work
08837.title: Office and Field Volunteers

08837.description: The Mobile Family Success Center of Middlesex County provides FREE educational and fun activities to the community. We serve all of Middlesex County but focus on East Brunswick, Edison, North Brunswick, Piscataway, and Sayreville. We are currently seeking volunteers to lead workshops, crafts, and classes. All of our activities center around our core services that include Health, Parent/Child Activities & Parent Education, Employment, Housing, Life Skills, Advocacy, and Information & Referral. We have some specific workshop & activity ideas in mind but are open to any and all ideas and offers. Below are some activities we currently conduct or hope to conduct with the right volunteer: Health related workshops geared toward youth/adults/seniors Easy, healthy recipe demonstrations Cupcake/Cookie decorating demos Crafts/Games/Workshops for parents & children or seniors Self Defense/Safety tips for eldery/adult/children Please visit our website and social media pages to see our monthly calendars and activities. http://www.ccdom.org/mfscmiddlesex https://www.facebook.com/MFSCMiddlesex https://twitter.com/MFSCMiddlesex
08837.title: Workshop Leaders Needed

08837.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. We are currently in need of Office volunteers! Our office is open Monday-Friday between the hours of 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Our Administrative/Office Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by filing, organizing, creating folders, organizing newsletters, collating manuals and participating in special projects. You will get to work very closely with our compassionate staff, creating bonds while gaining valuable hospice insight. For more information about our volunteer opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com! We look forward to hearing from you!
08837.title: Office Volunteers Needed!

08837.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08837.title: Adult Mentor

08831.description: Do a Christmas visit at The Gardens of Monroe. We are looking for a piano player to lead us in holiday carols. All are welcome to visit, sing carols and give gifts to the nursing home residence. We are accepting donations of stuffed animals as gifts. Please contact Nancy Mitrocsak, Team Leader, 609-558-2751 for information.
08831.title: The Gardens at Monroe- Holiday Project Christmas Day Visit

The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08831.title: Monroe, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08831.description: Greenwood House Hospice is a non-profit, non-sectarian hospice providing medical and nursing services, social workers, spiritual support, and volunteers to enhance the quality of living for those with terminal diagnosis. We serve patients in the Monroe area and are currently in need of compassionate and caring volunteers. There are many rewarding volunteer opportunities available. Training and support is provided. Activities may include patient and family visits, companionship and/or telephone calls; social and sensory stimulation for patients; crafts or handmade items for distribution; musician volunteers; office/clerical support; assistance with our bereavement program.
08831.title: Patient Contact Volunteer

10162.description: Simply by using your vehicle you can save animals - Volunteer your time to transport animals along what is called a \"Rescue Relay Transport\". Each week there are hundreds of animal rescue transports taking place where animals are moved from high-kill shelters to no-kill shelters and rescue organizations, as well as foster homes and adopters. It's easy for you to get involved and help save more animals simply by driving a leg in this relay. How it works: Click the I WANT TO HELP button. When an animal rescue organization posts a transport request, we will search to see if it matches your profile (if you're available and within the distance) and then send you an e-mail. Then you simply click on the leg that you can cover and everyone else will see that you've signed up for that leg. You'll get communications from the transport coordinator and, once the transport is a \"go\", you simply drive to the meeting place, load up the animals, and drive them to the next meeting place to hand them off to the next volunteer. You'll get plenty of doggy kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. There are videos that walk you through the process and give you tips and tricks on how to do transport. It's simple - and we need volunteers across the country, so share with your friends and help save an animal today!
10162.title: Drive a leg – Save a life! - New York, NY

10162.description: Loaning an animal your couch can save their life! - Every 16 seconds an animal is euthanized simply due to overpopulation.Shelters do not have unlimited space and unfortunately have to make room.Rescue groups do not have the facilities and rely on fosters to help.Simply by agreeing to foster you can save an animal’s life. How it works: 1.Click the I WANT TO HELP button 2.We’ll help match you up when there’s a need for a foster home.
10162.title: Let me crash on your couch… please? - New York, NY

10162.description: We need animal rescue transport coordinators to help organize rescue transports. So whether you are retired, not able to travel, or just looking for a way to save animals, we need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go, but we need volunteer transport coordinators to help set up and manage the trip. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport request, we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their transport. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Do you have a computer and a phone?  You can save animals! - New York, NY

10162.description: We need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. So whether you are a current pilot, retired pilot or you lost your medical, we still need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances, it’s more ideal to have pilots involved but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport flight request we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their flight. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Are you a pilot?  Then you can save animals! - New York, NY

10562.description: What does the Parent Child Together Program Do? Parent Child Together provides parents with peer-to-peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. What do the Volunteers Do? In the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months - if possible (there is flexibility for vacations etc.)
10562.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer in Ossining

10562.description: AIDSfreeAFRICA receives donations for shipment to and use in Cameroon, Africa. We pick up everything from a home hospital bed to cartons of textbooks to children's clothing and sports equipment. The donors are usually within 25 miles of Ossining, NY and we need people with the strength and vehicles to help when we have been granted a donation.
10562.title: Pick up Donations

10562.description: AIDSfreeAFRICA collects donated items in several categories (including medical and baby supplies) which are shipped once or twice annually to Cameroon. Items arrive in Ossining, NY without ideal sorting or packing for shipment and use. Several people will work together to repackage and inventory items in one storage location to then be moved to another until shipment. The amount of time any one person works is flexible but must be arranged in advance.
10562.title: Sort and pack items for Cameroon, Africa

10562.description: Pick up donations and bring to Ossining. We may have donations already that need to be picked up. Or we need volunteers to seek donations of books, toys and clothing for children. Household items are also welcome. Items may be new or gently used. Thank you, Rolande and Ellen
10562.title: Collect items for kids in Africa

10562.description: Meet for up to 2 hours at a time (weekly) to type all kinds of info into AIDSfreeAFRICA's computer (addresses, contacts, donor lists, trip diary, blog, mailchimp and so forth). Love the mission and vision of AIDSfreeAFRICA. You will have the opportunity to enjoy the satisfaction that comes with making a difference in peoples lives. You will learn things about one country in Africa in great detail and discover what gets lost in the News. And I may add, you will work with a dedicated bunch of people who believe that teaching to fish is preferable over giving fish.
10562.title: Secretary / Assistant to CEO

08820.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship with their certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08820.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Reiki - Edison

11229.description: Friendly Visiting NY works with Citymeals on Wheels and NYC Department for the Aging to alleviate the loneliness of our elderly homebound seniors. These seniors, located in Brooklyn, are looking for a weekly visit and at Friendly Visiting NY we can get you started! We will work with you to get you the ideal senior, location and visiting times! Our volunteers are important to us and help the impact of our program. One hour a week is all it takes! For more information call Libby at 718-449-5000 ext. 2212!
11229.title: 1 Senior 1 Volunteer and 2 Smiles
11229.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11229.description: Friendly Visiting NY, funded through Citymeals on Wheels, has partnered with DFTA to provide homebound seniors with weekly visits. Friendly visiting allows each senior to socialize with their visitor and build a lasting friendship. Whether discussing past life events, doing a recreational activity, reading a book for the visually impaired, the possibilities are endless and the contribution is priceless! Volunteers are screened as are all seniors in the program. Matches are carefully made base don location, interest and requests of both the volunteers and seniors. To speak to someone about the opportunity call 718-449-5000 ext. 2212 or click to learn more and sign up!
11229.title: An Oldie but Goodie: Friendly Visiting
11229.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11229.description: The main function of an office volunteer is to provide the office with assistance and support. This includes but is not limited to the following: Tasks include filing, mailings, making copies, compiling admission packets, other packets used by hospice field staff and other staff assistance depending on the individual expertise and qualifications.
11229.title: Office Volunteer
11229.org: Caring Hospice Services of New York

11229.description: Hospice volunteers: Visit patients in their homes and in facilities offering companionship and a chance to reminisce Read books, newspapers and other favorites to people when they aren’t able themselves Assist with small errands for the patient and family. Share their talents and gifts... Play Music, sing, draw at bedside of patient, create photo albums, knitt blankets and more. Provide patient the opportunity to tell his/her life story through the use of video, (if patient or caregiver has one available), audio and/or the written word. Office Volunteers assist office staff with basic tasks such as copying and filing, helping with web research, spreadsheets and more. Contribute to volunteer newsletter keeping volunteers and staff in tune with the Hospice Volunteer Program’s activities.
11229.title: Hospice Field Volunteer
11229.org: Caring Hospice Services of New York

07410.description: Support market-based climate and energy solutions! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) is a strictly nonpartisan organization that empowers volunteers to engage their members of Congress to advocate for our market-based climate solution. You will work with fellow concerned New Jersey citizens to address climate change risk, thereby securing our families, livelihoods and ecosystems. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. CCL supports volunteers to: Meet with Congressional leaders Write letters to the editor and op-eds Meet with local media Build support among constituents and community leaders for our legislative proposal We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers Weekly skill building sessions On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world! Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you. https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
07410.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Fair Lawn NJ

07410.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN decide which program you want to be a part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become familiarized with Homecare Homebase software Work on Special Projects when needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Benefits Increase purpose and meaning in your life by positively impacting other lives Experience significant opportunities for personal growth and development Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule Internship Credit (if applicable) Develop interpersonal skills Build your resume Reference Letter after a period of commitment Join our team of volunteers who make a difference!!
07410.title: Hospice/Healthcare Volunteers Needed - Fair Lawn, Ridgewood Area

07410.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07410.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Fair Lawn

07410.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN Decide Which Program You Want to be Part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become Familarized with Homecare Homebase Work on Special Projects as needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patient's quality of life Visit patients in facilities or their homes in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Specialized Volunteers Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers Certified Reiki Practitioners Licensed Message Therapists Program Benefits Increase Meaning and Purpose in Your Life by Positively Impacting Other Lives Experience Significant Opportunities for Personal Growth and Development Convenient FREE Training that Fits Your Schedule Free TB Test Develop Interpersonal Skills Build Your Resume Reference Letter Join this fun opportunity and help make a difference!
07410.title: Hospice/Healthcare Volunteers in Fairlawn - No Experience Needed

07410.description: Description Use what you have learned in the classroom to help improve the quality of life for hospice patients. Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule Receive Internship Credit (if applicable-unpaid)
07410.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students!

07410.description: Assist a teenager to build healthy relationships and develop independence while encouraging specific talents, hobbies and/or vocational interests. Reliable and consistent, also comfortable with teens. Our mentors are responsible, caring, adult figures with whom these teenagers can build a bridge of trust. The difference you can make in the life of a child is extraordinary.
07410.title: Mentors for Teenagers in Foster Care
07410.org: Children's Aid and Family Services, Inc.
