07052.description: A Jersey Cares Project Coordinator will assist volunteers in mentoring students by leading book discussions, assisting students in studying for exams, helping in creative arts or just by talking about the everyday challenges of life. Volunteers are needed to help highly motivated, academically qualified, yet economically disadvantaged eighth grade students with their math and writing. The program’s goal is to develop future leaders through education. Students participate in a rigorous 14-month preparatory program that places them in competitive, primarily independent, secondary schools. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07052.title: Tutor and Mentor in West Orange

07052.description: Reading Buddies, a program of the RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties at Jewish Family Service MetroWest, engages older adult volunteers in promoting childhood literacy in public schools. Volunteers age 55+ read to the same small group of students each week throughout the school year using a read-aloud format that supplements the school’s regular reading curriculum. Reading Buddies is a one of a kind program that uses volunteers to support children grades k-2 and educators in the classroom. This program is a one hour commitment once a week. All volunteers must submit to a background check. If you are interested in signing up to read to children or would like to know what schools we currently need volunteers in, please contact Julie Cramer at jcramer@jfsmetrowest.org or 973-637-1761.
07052.title: Reading Buddies (Essex County)

07052.description: Do you want to make a difference in the life of a terminally ill patient? Our patients are located all over NJ, in various facilities and in their homes. We are looking for caring people to offer companionship to our patients. There is no experience necessary, we will train you and be there to support you with everything you do for us! Volunteers are truly appreciated and valued! We will work around your availability and location preferences. Types of volunteers Administrative Volunteering- Assisting with office clerical duties such as phones, mailings, filing. Direct Patient Volunteers- Meeting with patients in the facilities or in their homes. Simply offer companionship by talking, listening, watching TV, reading or any other activity that may interest the patient. Do you have special talents you would like to share? Art? Music? Pet Therapy? I would love to discuss those with you also!!! To discuss opportunities further please email AJ Blair, Volunteer Coordinator at ablair@serenityhospicenj.com. I look forward to hearing from you!!!! Thank you for your consideration!!!!!
07052.title: Serenity Hospice Is Looking For Caring People To Volunteer With Our Patients!

07052.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers to visit our hospice patients throughout Northern NJ. Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. Your dog must be certified and the handler needs training by Life Choice Hospice as a hospice volunteer. Volunteer training and medical requirements are provided FREE by Life Choice. Please help bring companionship and joy into the life of a Hospice patient!
07052.title: Share Your Pet’s Love – Seeking Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice!

07052.description: Description Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building Massage Therapist, Raiki Certified, Pet Therapy Certified come and make a difference We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule
07052.title: Caring Hospice/Healthcare Volunteers Needed in West Orange, NJ

07055.description: ST. PAUL’S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AMERICORPS PROGRAM BENEFITS AmeriCorps is the domestic version of the Peace Corps. AmeriCorps Members dedicate one year of their life to serve communities throughout the United States that are in need. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). Position Type: Full-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete: 1700 Bi-weekly Financial Stipend: $528.84 Total Stipend Amount: $13,750.00 Educational Award: $5,920.00 *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448 Service Activities/Responsibilities: Case management using wraparound principles, and building of programs Active role in fundraising activities for social services program Integrating food pantry and case management for clients that require complex interventions Facilitating employment (resume building, job openings, etc.) Working closely and collaborating with Case Manager Special projects as assigned Occasional home visits Conducting initial and ongoing assessment of client(s) that includes information such as medical, psychological, economic, and social factors Arranging and executing additional programming Know Your Rights Trainings Financial Literacy Service Goals: Increasing food security for clients through food pantry Increasing capacity of SMILE to meet community needs Economically empowering clients to become self sufficient Providing quality service with genuine care and attention Maintaining accurate and up-to-date records Maintaining client confidence and confidentiality Position Requirements/Qualifications Commitment, Patience, Flexibility Problem solving & analytical skills Effective communication skills Bachelors in Social Work or related training/certification NJ Licensed Social Worker or New Jersey State Licensure for MSW. Fluency in Arabic a plus Training and Evaluation Attend meetings, in-service and training sessions identified by SPCDC AmeriCorps Program and Smile for Charity. Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week, and events sponsored by the Corporation for National & Community Service.
07055.title: Extended Services Case Manager (AmeriCorps)

07055.description: Assist in many ways to make the lives of seniors living in the community more satisfying. You can drive, deliver meals, visit at home, escort to Doctors appointments, help plan recreational activities/ privide support in-home to families with sprcial needs children
07055.title: senior companion/special needs respite

07055.description: There are a number of ways in which one can relate to senior citizens, reading to those who are visually impaired, driving for meals on wheels, joing our aging in place program and assisting in program planning and on site visits, serving lunch once a week, or newly added to our program, teaching and playing wii!
07055.title: Senior relationship volunteer

07055.description: Deliver meals to homes of elderly. Drive seniors to Doctor appointments. Drive seniors to Club Sequoia when van is not available.
07055.title: Driver

07054.description: The CFF Greater New Jersey Chapter needs assistance in making phone calls to previous annual fund donors and informing them of the 2018 Annual Fund Campaign. The CFF Annual Fund provides important, unrestricted resources that help us advance our mission. It helps us develop new treatments and pursue every opportunity for promising research that can lead us to a cure for Cystic Fibrosis.
07054.title: Annual Fund Phone Banking
07054.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07054.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship with their certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Rahway office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07054.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion - Parsippany

07054.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers to visit our hospice patients throughout Northern NJ. Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. Your dog must be certified and the handler needs training by Life Choice Hospice as a hospice volunteer. Volunteer training and medical requirements are provided FREE by Life Choice. Please help bring companionship and joy into the life of a Hospice patient!
07054.title: Share Your Pet’s Love – Seeking Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice!

07054.description: Description Use what you have learned in the classroom to help improve the quality of life for hospice patients. Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule Receive Internship Credit (if applicable-unpaid)
07054.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students!

07054.description: The Community Companions Program (CCP) provides one-to-one companionship and assistance in daily living to people with mental illnesses. The companion visits the client at least once a week, for a minimum of three months, participating in mutually agreeable activities. Together they find new social groups, learn about community resources, and share in a supportive friendship. Volunteers will receive training, which will include an orientation to mental illness and mental health, an overview of community resources and practice in successful communication skills. Upon completion of training, volunteers will have the opportunity to share skills and interests with someone who needs social support as a supplement to mental health services. Please call Marissa Ferrito 973-334-3496 ext. 113 for more information.
07054.title: Community Companion Program
07054.org: Mental Health Association of Essex and Morris  (MHAEMC)

07054.description: The Mental Health Players, sponsored by MHAMC, are accepting volunteer applications. The Players are a group of volunteers who use improvisational role plays to portray real life situations. The players perform for various groups including schools, civic organizations, businesses, and church groups. Players come from all walks of life to help educate the community about mental health issues. The Players deal with a broad range of issues. These include mental health, substance abuse, peer pressure, aging, and other social issues. The performance usually lasts an hour and includes 3 role plays. To become a volunteer or to gather additional information, please call Tracy Cappiccille at 973-334-3496, ext. 112.
07054.title: Mental Health Players (MHP)
07054.org: Mental Health Association of Essex and Morris  (MHAEMC)

11102.description: You are a charismatic teacher or tutor of civics, government, or US history with a passion for teaching immigrant students. You want to work closely with a small group of students to help them reach their reading, writing, and speaking goals. Sound like you? Good! CIANA is looking for a volunteer civics instructor to teach once or twice per week. Our classes are typically composed of 10-20 students whose English proficiency ranges from beginner to intermediate who are studying to take their US citizenship exam. You must be comfortable managing a diverse group of students and facilitating fun and interactive activities. Description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa, and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. Responsibilities: Write and deliver civics lessons to prepare students for naturalization interview based on a curriculum Facilitate lessons in a fun and accessible way while enhancing their English reading, writing, speaking, and listening Collaborate with other civics teachers on lesson development and execution Assist in tracking student needs and progress Required: Consistent availability on Monday and/or Wednesday from 10:00am to 12:00pm Charismatic, dynamic, and interactive instruction methods Motivated to help students achieve their goals Competent in and respectful of cultural differences ​ Bonus Points: Retirees are welcome Interest in civics, government, or US history Passionate about advancing immigrant rights Fluency or bilingualism in another language (especially Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali) Compensation: Unpaid Hours: 2-4 hours per week; not flexible To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume to volunteer@cianainc.org. Or find out more about us on our social media or website and let’s chat: @cianainc or www.cianainc.org
11102.title: Volunteer Civics Teacher
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: You are a charismatic teacher or tutor of the English language with a passion for teaching ESL or ESOL students. You want to work closely with a small group of students to help them reach their reading, writing, and speaking goals. Sound like you? Good! CIANA is looking for a volunteer ESL instructor to teach once or twice per week. Our classes are typically composed of 10-20 students whose English proficiency ranges from beginner to intermediate. You must be comfortable managing a diverse group of students and facilitating fun and interactive activities. Description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa, and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. Responsibilities: Write and deliver English lessons that incorporate reading, writing, speaking, and listening components based on a curriculum Facilitate lessons on life skills and practical English in a fun and accessible way Collaborate with other ESL teachers on lesson development and execution Assist in tracking student needs and progress ​ Required: Consistent availability on Tuesday and/or Thursday from 10:00am to 12:00pm Charismatic, dynamic, and interactive instruction methods Motivated to help students achieve their goals Competent in and respectful of cultural differences Bonus Points: Students enrolled in a CELTA, TESOL, or TEFL program or retired teachers Passionate about advancing immigrant rights Fluency or bilingualism in another language (especially Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali) Compensation: Unpaid Hours: 2-4 hours per week; not flexible To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume to volunteer@cianainc.org. Or find out more about us on our social media or website and let’s chat: @cianainc or www.cianainc.org
11102.title: Volunteer ESL Teacher
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Are you looking for a chance to inspire and teach students? To help an underprivileged community succeed? Then CIANA needs you! We are currently looking for Volunteer Middle School Tutors to assist and teach middle school students. You will be working alongside talented CIANA staff. This opportunity presents a fantastic way to foster personal responsibility, teamwork skills and leadership! Description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa, and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. Responsibilities: Help middle school students with homework, test prep, and projects Assist CIANA staff with maintaining a safe and organized classroom environment Work alongside other volunteers with preparing and executing curriculum Required: Exceptional abilities in reading, writing, math or science Charismatic and confident with adolescent children Consistent availability at least one day per week from 3:00pm to 6:00pm Bonus Points: Passionate about advancing immigrant rights Fluency or bilingualism in another language (especially Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali) To apply, please submit a cover letter, resume, and portfolio to volunteer@cianainc.org. Or find out more about us on our IG and let’s chat: @cianainc
11102.title: Volunteer Middle School Tutor
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Want to help spark a child’s interest in STEM fields? The Variety Boys & Girls Club is seeking volunteers for our after school science and technology classes! The Variety Boys and Girls Club of Queens is a non-profit organization that specializes in providing children ages 6-18 with the highest quality programming. Our programs include homework help, swimming and sports, coding, engineering, gourmet cooking, drama, dance, media production and so much more. Duties and Responsibilities: Support elementary and middle school students in science and technology classes Help facilitate activities and projects in a variety of STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math) subject areas including: coding, robotics, media production and engineering. Be an encouraging and positive influence for participants When: 4:30-6:30 pm Monday-Friday How to Get Started: Fill out an application on our website to get involved! https://bgcqueens.org/volunteer-application
11102.title: After School STEM Volunteers
11102.org: Variety Boys & Girls Club of Queens

11102.description: Looking for a way to give back to youth in your community? The Variety Boys & Girls Club of Queens is currently seeking volunteers for our 2018-2019 after school program! The Variety Boys and Girls Club of Queens(VBGCQ) is a non-profit organization that specializes in providing children ages 6-18 with the highest quality programming. Our programs include homework help, swimming and sports, coding, engineering, gourmet cooking, drama, dance, media production and so much more. The Club is looking for dedicated homework helpers and tutors to volunteer for Power Hour, our homework help and tutoring program offered daily to all Club participants. Students complete homework in groups based on grade level and are assisted by a teacher and volunteers. Join us to help youth succeed in school and build great futures! Duties and Responsibilities: Support elementary and middle school students in completing daily homework assignments Assist participants in various subject areas including Reading and Writing, Math, Science, Social Studies Tutor participants who need extra help in a specific subject area Help students study for upcoming exams or complete projects Be an encouraging and positive influence for participants so they can start the school day with confidence No previous teaching or tutoring experience required, simply have a willingness to help! When: 2:30-3:30 pm Monday-Friday How to Get Started: Fill out an application on our website to get involved! https://bgcqueens.org/volunteer-application
11102.title: Homework Help & Tutoring Volunteers
11102.org: Variety Boys & Girls Club of Queens

11102.description: The Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a small, community-based organization in Astoria, Queens that seeks to integrate new immigrants from the Middle-East/North Africa, and South Asia into the socio-economic and civic life of American society, with a focus on family and children’s services. CIANA seeks volunteer attorneys to support its work delivering immigration workshops in Queens public libraries. The Pathway to US Citizenship Program provides immigrants with important information about how to become US Citizens through the process of naturalization. Responsibilities: Deliver interactive immigration law workshops in libraries around Queens. Develop new materials to reflect rapidly changing immigration law landscape. Report to Director of Legal Services when clients need follow-up assistance. Qualifications: Independent, confident, and motivated to help immigrants in need of legal information. Demonstrated commitment to social justice issues. Willingness to travel to libraries around Queens on Saturday afternoons. Admitted to NY bar preferred. Fluency in a language other than English is a plus. JD 2+ years of immigration experience.
11102.title: Volunteer Immigration Attorneys
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: You are a go-getter, a doer, someone who thinks big and acts big. You might not be a leader yet, but you’ve got what it takes to be one. You want to collaborate with great team of people. Got all of that? Then CIANA wants You. We are currently looking to assemble a team of creative communications interns to inspire our pro-immigration allies and turn them into donors and activists. Your role will be to design and optimize our content across our social media platforms, as well as to come up with creative ideas while maintaining our core identity and values. Description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa, and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. ​ Responsibilities: Regularly update content on CIANA’s website, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter accounts to increase engagement and awareness Collaborate with outreach and fundraising team to devise strategies/campaigns to solicit donors, volunteers, and clients Track outcomes of various communication techniques (email campaigns, Facebook posts, videos, etc), and solidify best practices Compile photos and video from events to highlight CIANA’s vibrant community Qualifications: ​ Current or recent undergraduates pursuing or hold a bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, journalism, graphic design, or a related field Required: Being a self-starter Strong writing skills and attention to detail A passion for creating content embodying our current brand design One or more of the following: Knowledge of adobe software (inDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop) Experience writing for a school publication, online magazine, or blog Experience with executing successful campaigns on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter Bonus Points: Experience with photography, video production, and editing Fluency or bilingualism in another language (especially Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali) Willingness to attend events and live tweet on behalf of CIANA To apply, please submit a cover letter, resume, and portfolio to volunteer@cianainc.org . Or find out more about us on our ig and let’s chat. @cianainc
11102.title: Creative Communications Volunteer
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. We are currently looking for a volunteer or intern that in fluent in Bengali, Arabic, and/or Spanish to assist clients in various aspects of our services. ​ Responsibilities: Translate documents such as flyers, brochures, class materials, etc. Collaborate with outreach, program, and office management teams to integrate languages into materials for clients and staff Interpret on behalf of clients who walk in or call the office for assistance Assist in community outreach and case management activities to engage with clients in their native language ​ Requirements: Fluency in English and at least one of the following: Arabic, Bengali, and/or Spanish Have a go-with-the-flow attitude Extremely organized and able to prioritize goals and accomplish them Able to preform many tasks with a \"can do\" attitude Respectful and sensitive to other cultures Exhibits professionalism while interacting with clients and representing the organization Is a self-starter who also works well in teams ​ How to Apply: Please send a cover letter and resume to volunteer@ cianainc.org. Please include the position title in the subject line of the application.
11102.title: Translator (Bengali, Arabic, or Spanish)
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Established in 2006, the Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants into American society. We have one open opportunity for an experienced grant writer to join us in preparing proposals and grants. This is not a teaching opportunity, please only apply if you have prior grant writing experience. The Grant writer intern will be responsible for applying to at least 2 grants per month. Credit is available for those in college. The grants we apply to are a mixture of municipal, corporate, and foundational of varying lengths for the purpose of supporting educational, legal, and civics-related programs or operational costs. Requirements: have 1-2 years of experience writing grants commit to a minimum once a week, part of which can be done remotely for the right candidate be available for a minimum of 3 months ​ To apply, please send your resume, cover letter, and a writing sample of no more than 5 pages to volunteer@cianainc.org
11102.title: Grant Writer Volunteer
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11101.description: Role & Responsibilities Are you looking to get involved in community service? Do you want to positively impact the lives of immigrants and refugees while building your portfolio? We’re currently seeking a Front Desk Volunteer for our Long Island City, Queens office! Answer the telephone to provide information regarding AAFSC’s services Redirect inquiries to appropriate staff members as needed Greet visitors and clients to the office warmly Assist Arabic-speaking clients and program participants with translation Complete administrative tasks including sorting mail, paperwork, and supplies Maintain front desk supplies and information Mandatory Qualifications: Must be over 18 Bilingual - must speak English and Arabic fluently Must have good phone etiquette Must have a passion for AAFSC’s mission and a commitment to cross-cultural sensitivity Must be willing to complete a background check Experience working with immigrants and refugees or other marginalized communities a plus. To learn more and apply, please contact: volunteers@aafscny.org
11101.title: Front Desk Volunteer

11101.description: The election is over. Now the real work begins. It’s up to you, as a constituent, to hold your new members of Congress accountable. It’s up to you to fight for the country and world you want to live in. That’s what you’ll do as a RESULTS advocate in Long Island . RESULTS is a movement of passionate, committed, everyday people. Together we use our voices to influence political decisions that will bring an end to poverty. We’ve been doing this for 38 years, and we know that change doesn’t happen just because we vote. It doesn’t happen just because there are new faces on Capitol Hill. It happens because you tell your members of Congress what you care about and what they can do about it. It happens because you make calls, you write letters, and you go to Capitol Hill. It happens because you demand it to happen. As a RESULTS volunteer, you will learn how to be an effective advocate in the fight against poverty. Practically, that means: *Learning how to develop a relationship with your member of Congress so that when you get in touch, they listen. *Developing media skills so you can write punchy, persuasive opinion pieces and convince editorial boards to write about RESULTS issues. *Joining a movement of people committed to ending the systemic and structural injustices that drive poverty. *Meeting with your RESULTS group monthly for training, updates, and action. *Taking your message and skills straight to Capitol Hill. Our staff is based in Washington D.C. and we have community chapters across the United States. Learn more at results.org. What are you waiting for? Start influencing the policies that impact your life and the lives of millions of people around the world. Become a RESULTS advocate. Once you sign up, you’ll get an email with more information and have the opportunity to register for an orientation call.
11101.title: Long Island: You voted. Now start influencing policy.

11101.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide academic support in math for the Division of Continuing Education at LaGuardia Community College for the Spring 2019 semester. Study Groups with multiple students will run in the evening from 5-6PM. Evening study groups can run Monday, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. This a great opportunity for: working professionals who wish to support their community students who are majoring (or who have recently graduated) in the course area and who wish to enhance their content knowledge and/or grow their professional experience As a study group leader, you would facilitate sessions to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. You would identify and support students who are struggling, encourage discussion and problem solving by students , and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Spring semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about LaGuardia Community College's Division of Continuing Education here: https://www.laguardia.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11101.title: 5pm - 6pm Math Tutor needed for LaGuardia Community College HSE Program in Spring 2019

11101.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide in-class academic support in reading and writing for the Division of Continuing Education at LaGuardia Community College for the Spring 2019 semester. Embedded Tutoring will run in the morning from 9:30 AM - 1:30 PM. Tutors are asked to commit 2-3 hours of their time a week. Morning classes run Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays, but subject specific tutoring days are yet to be determined. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Spring semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about LaGuardia Community College's Division of Continuing Education here: https://www.laguardia.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11101.title: Spring 2019 Morning In-class Writing Tutor needed for LaGuardia Community College HSE Program

Learn more about LaGuardia Community College's Division of Continuing Education here: https://www.laguardia.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11101.title: Spring 2019 Morning In-class Math Tutor needed for LaGuardia Community College HSE Program

11101.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide in-class academic support in math for the Division of Continuing Education at LaGuardia Community College for the Spring 2019 semester. Embedded Tutoring will run in the evening from 6-9PM. Tutors are asked to commit 2-3 hours of their time a week. Evening classes run Monday, Tuesdays, and Thursdays, but subject specific tutoring days are yet to be determined. This a great opportunity for: working professionals who wish to support their community students who are majoring (or who have recently graduated) in the course area and who wish to enhance their content knowledge and/or grow their professional experience As an embedded tutor, you would collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to augment the class topic discussions, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Spring semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about LaGuardia Community College's Division of Continuing Education here: https://www.laguardia.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.

11101.description: The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind (AIFB) formally known as \"Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation (ABWC)\": Enhancing the lives of blind individuals in the country since August 28, 2009, AIFB has been recognized by NY State as a non-profit foundation. Its mission is to empower Afghan blind women through healthcare and blind children through education and rehabilitation services in Afghanistan. The foundation accepts national and international students. The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind needs your time as a volunteer! Qualification and Commitment: Student must complete 3 months internship 5 days per week (6 hours per day), equalling around 500 hours per semester. Students are required to be fluent in English. Bilingual students who are fluent in Persian and Pashto are welcomed. Requirement: The foundation request the following for students: Your email address, mailing address and phone number College requirement forms from your department Resume One page short bio that explains your education background (your work experience in the past your current position as employee or student and volunteer experience in the past) Sample of writing 2 letters of references one from the university and one from colleagues and friends (not family members) along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers The university internship department contact information (mailing address, email address, phone number, fax number, and cell phone). AIFB does not accept independent student interns, only one sponsored or approved by their university. The student must participate in face to face interviews before entering to the internship program.
11101.title: Student Intern Department
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11101.description: Ballet For All Kids is a non-profit organization whose mission is to give every child, regardless of their abilities or disabilities, the opportunity to reap the benefits of a classical ballet education. We depend on the community to volunteer and help make a difference in the lives of kids with special needs. Come and assist students as they learn ballet technique. All volunteers must be passionate about our mission and comfortable working with children. No dance experience necessary. Consistent weekly volunteers preferred, but one-time help is also greatly appreciated! We hold classes Saturdays and Sundays in various locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens as well as New Jersey. Please check our website for our current class schedule: https://www.balletforallkids.com/classes/ If you are interesting, please contact us to let us know which class you would like to join and when you would be able to start volunteering with us! We would also love to learn a bit more about you and why you would like to volunteer. Contact us today for more information.
11101.title: Dance class for kids with disabilities - LIC, Queens

11101.description: There are more than 11,000 children in New York State whose mothers are imprisoned. The absence of their mother leaves them vulnerable, particularly the older children, who face increased risk of involvement with crime substance abuse and other anti-social behaviors. Without good care and attention, they become victims of the prison system. The core of Hour Children’s work is to reverse this outcome. Hour Friends in Deed mentoring program provides a child, between the ages of 4-17, with a caring adult who commits to building a healthy relationship with a young person. The mentor becomes someone that supports and guides the child with positive academic, career, and personal goals. We encourage mentors and mentees to find fun activities to do together. Both of you can pick to play sports, go to the movies, do arts & crafts, or any activity where you both will have FUN! Your positive influence will contribute to the growth and development of this child. We specifically need mentors for children who live in the Bronx. Each mentor, 18 years or older, commits to participate in the program for one year and to meet with his/her mentee for at least 4 hours per month. Become a mentor. Be part of the solution and make an impact on a child’s life!!!!
11101.title: Mentors needed in Bronx 10453 area

11101.description: The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind (AIFB) formally known as \"Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation (ABWC)\": Enhancing the lives of blind individuals in the country since August 28, 2009, AIFB has been recognized by NY State as a non-profit foundation. Its mission is to empower Afghan blind women through healthcare and blind children through education and rehabilitation services in Afghanistan. The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind needs your time as a volunteer! Qualification and responsability: The AIFB is looking for professional or experienced web designers who have at least 2 years of experience working with websites. The Web Designer responsability is to help the AIFB maintain and update its website with current events and happenings. This is a major need for the organization at this time and will only involve occasional commitments of 4 or 5 hours per month. Improve website design and general online presence Make web content updates Manage switching our website host provider over to a new company Lead the purchase of an additional URL Help implement an email address for Board members that ends in the website extension General trouble shooting as issues arise Required documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews are required.
11101.title: Web Designer
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11101.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
11101.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Long Island NY

11101.description: Tax Preparation Volunteers , Urban Upbound, formerly known as ERDA. Urban Upbound provides residents of public housing neighborhoods and other moderate, low- and very-low income New Yorkers with the tools and resources needed to achieve self-sufficiency and economic mobility, and to break intergenerational cycles of poverty. The target area we serve includes the 30,000 residents of five public housing neighborhoods in Western Queens: Queensbridge (the largest public housing community in the nation), Ravenswood, Astoria, Woodside, and Pomonok. The neighborhoods where these communities are located include Long Island City, Woodside, Astoria, and Flushing. One of Urban Upbound's most successful initiatives is our Free Tax Preparation Campaign, where we help low-income filers access the tax credits for which they are eligible - saving working families hundreds of dollars in unnecessary tax preparation fees. Additionally, tax filers have the opportunity to: enroll in Urban Upbound's workforce development program to receive assistance finding work; sign up for one-on-one financial counseling; get pre-screened for food stamps, public assistance and low or no cost health insurance; and, open a bank account. We are currently recruiting volunteers to help make this year's tax prep season another success! As a volunteer you will have the unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, high impact, results oriented community based organization. Qualified candidates will utilize their accounting and financial skills while giving back to the community. All volunteer tax preparers are asked to successfully complete the IRS online Link & Learn course. Long Island City does free taxes all year round! Skills and Qualifications Ability to work with diverse populations Commitment to social and economic justice Excellent time-management and organizational skills Independent self-starter Strong teamwork abilities Bilingual (Spanish; Mandarin, Korean) a plus Facility with numbers and commitment to learning tax law and Tax Wise software
11101.title: Tax Preparation Volunteers

Description: The AIFB is looking forward to working with Media and Communications in order to spread the mission and vision of the Foundation worldwide. We can make a difference by introducing our status and the youth of our services for this important cause and be able to receive support from others through various media channels. We are looking for volunteers with experience in working in publicity such as newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, publishing, etc. We would like to work with the media, primarily print media, in promoting The Blind Women and Children Foundation. Qualification and responsability: The focus of this role is to: Attract different avenues of the media in order to express the mission and the vision of the Foundation to the public Schedule and provide opportunities for the media to participate in different events and activities in the AIFB Foundation Allow the media to interview different individuals or departments in the Foundation Create guidelines for methods of communication with the media including telephone calls, internet outreach, face-to-face meetings, radio, and other media- related technology. Create press releases regarding the mission of the Foundation and any special announcements given by the AIFB Board. Research and create mailing lists and telephone contact lists for the purpose of outreach and for use with all media communication. Update and publish all articles and materials on the AIFB website. In addidtion, update, revise, and make changes (including images) to the foundation website inculding Faceboook, Twitter, Volunteer pages, YouTube, LinkedIn and monitoring Board Member emails to the Foundation Website. Required documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers

The mission of The Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation is to empower Afghan blind women through healthcare and blind children through education and rehabilitation services in Afghanistan. The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind needs your time as a volunteer! Description: The AIFB Foundation is seeking DEDICATED board members to improve the quality of life for blind individuals in Afghanistan. As a board member, you will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the medical, educational welfare, rehabilitation, and community services to help over 400,000 blind indivduals in Afghanistan. Qualification and responsability: The primary work of the Board of Director is to make decision on behalf of the foundation and work as a team to make sure that decisions made by the board are executed legallyThey will be required to participate in Board meetings every 3 months, if an individual misses 3 board meetings without giving prior notice they will be removed from the board. Must be able to commit 6 months to 1 year Must cast the majority of board of director's vote in order to become a member Be able to answer any questions that arise from the board members Must be able to support the foundation in the amount of 300$ annually or encourage people to support the treasury of the organization Their responsibility as a board member will be to help us extend our contact network, recruiting or improving board of director functions, fundraise, and make accurate decisions that benefits the mission and vision of the organizations. Requirement Must have strong leadership skills Must be able to make decisions that benefit the welfare of the organization Be able to conduct and participate in fundraising events Individuals who are willing to become Board of Directors need to submit the following documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews required.
11101.title: Board Member Needed for Organization to Aid the Blind
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11106.description: Energy Tech High School is launching a new mentoring program for our Year 13 and 14 students! We are looking for volunteer career mentors who are currently working within STEM fields, specifically in companies or organizations related to Engineering, Technology, Construction, and Architecture. As a mentor in this program you will be paired with college students who attend LaGuardia Community College working toward an associate degree in either Energy Technology or Engineering, with a focus in Mechanical or Electrical. The mentoring program is an integral component of the school’s commitment to connect what students learn in the classroom to the realities of the workplace. We believe mentoring helps students gain new skills and explore career options.
11106.title: Energy Tech High Career Mentor

11106.description: Must be 21 years old + The DYCD is looking to recruit African-American/ Hispanic males (but we won’t deny anyone) Someone who is employed in a career level job and/or pursuing higher education Great personality/ Willingness to impact the Youth positively
11106.title: The Young Men’s Initiative (YMI)

11106.description: Our client choice, supermarket-style food pantry runs three distributions per week for two hours each. Our distribution hours are Mondays, 2:00 - 4:00; Tuesdays, 10:30 - 12:30; and Thursdays, 3:00 - 5:00. We seek volunteers for all three shifts, but especially Mondays and Thursdays! Your time commitment will involve arriving at least one hour prior to the start of distribution, and staying through the entire two hour shift. Responsibilities include stocking shelves, sorting and storing produce, helping clients shop, breaking down boxes, and routine clean up. We are also seeking a dedicated desk volunteer who is responsible for checking in clients when they arrive. This is energetic, fast-paced work with a lovely group of core volunteers from the community! We strive to provide food to those in need in the most welcoming, warm way possible. Bring your customer service skills! Bilingual abilities are definitely a plus as well. Please apply ONLY if you will be committing to volunteer with us at least once per week for at least one month. We are unable to train volunteers for a one-time shift.
11106.title: Help feed the hungry in Queens!
11106.org: Hour Children Community Outreach and Food Pantry

11106.description: There are more than 11,000 children in New York State whose mothers are imprisoned. The absence of their mother leaves them vulnerable, particularly the older children, who face an increased risk of involvement with crime substance abuse and other anti-social behaviors. Without good care and attention, they become victims of the prison system. The core of Hour Children’s work is to reverse this outcome. Hour Friends in Deed mentoring program provides a child, between the ages of 4-17, with a caring adult who commits to building a healthy relationship with a young person. The mentor becomes someone that supports and guides the child with positive academic, career, and personal goals. We encourage mentors and mentees to find fun activities to do together. Both of you can pick to play sports, go to the movies, do arts & crafts, or any activity where you both will have FUN! Your positive influence will contribute to the growth and development of this child. We specifically need mentors for children who live in Staten Island. Each mentor, 18 years or older, commits to participate in the program for one year and to meet with his/her mentee for at least 4 hours per month. Become a mentor. Be part of the solution and make an impact on a child’s life!!!!
11106.title: Mentor a Child in Long Island City, Queens

11104.description: The Senior Center provides around 200 meals a day to seniors. Volunteers will provide assistance in the senior center dining room and kitchen for lunch service, which includes food preparation, distribution and clean up. WHAT WILL I BE DOING? Under the direction of the kitchen supervisor you might be: Wrapping silverware Preparing components of the meals Serving meals Providing table service Assisting with clean up Washing dishes/pots and pans Wiping down tables Signing in Seniors YOUR QUALITIES: Commitment and Consistent Considerate and patient Available Mondays through Fridays 9am to 2pm Work well with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitive to diverse cultures Food handler OR OSHA certified preferred but not mandatory
11104.title: Help Serve Lunch to Seniors at Sunnyside!

11104.description: Chinese Hotline Volunteer at Catholic Migration Services We are seeking a volunteers to remotely operate a Chinese Immigration Hotline, and/or who can occasionally come into our Queens Office in Sunnyside to provide translation and interpretation services, including translating foreign language documents into English. Our greatest need is for persons who are bilingual in Mandarin/Cantonese Chinese and English. Volunteers can assist with any ONE or ALL of the following activities: Operate the Chinese Immigration Hotline, including answering calls, responding to messages, and recording away-messages (can be REMOTE) Provide language interpretation services in our office, and occasionally accompany attorneys to help translate during court. Both consecutive interpretation and simultaneous interpretation skills are welcome. Translate foreign language documents into English. Examples of typical documents include birth certificates, affidavits, diplomas or degrees from foreign institutions, medical records, and foreign language news articles. Training will be provided. All services will be supervised by a staff attorney. For those who need to report pro bono hours, we will track the number of hours worked. Qualifications: Must be fluent in a Chinese dialect to provide interpretation and translation services. Who We Are: Founded in 1971, Catholic Migration Services is committed to \"welcoming the stranger in our midst,\" by empowering underserved immigrant communities in Brooklyn and Queens. We provide high quality legal services, know-your-rights education, and advocacy to immigrants to advance equality and social justice in a changing and diverse population. Our services are available without regard to national origin, religion or immigration status. Catholic Migration Services is a not-for-profit corporation with 501(c)(3) status and affiliated with Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens and the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn. Site: Chinese Hotline Operator may work remotely with occasional assistance at our Queens office located at 47-01 Queens Blvd, Suite 201, Sunnyside, NY 11104. Contact: Katie Searle, Volunteer Coordinator Email: ksearle@catholicmigration.org Phone: (718) 236-3000 ext. 204 IF YOU ARE INTERESTED, please contact our Volunteer Coordinator or COPY & PASTE the following link in a separate window to FILL OUT OUR VOLUNTEER QUESTIONNAIRE: https://goo.gl/forms/rYMwrE26QbXXca0Y2
11104.title: Do you speak a Chinese Dialect? Immigration Legal Translator Needed

11104.description: I currently have a senior with a dog and a cat in Sunnyside and the dog needs to be walked! Could you walk the dog, even once a week for six months? Could you help once a week? Studies show that having a pet can significantly improve a person's mental and physical health. Many seniors have pets, but need a little help caring for them. HELP A SENIOR KEEP THEIR PET!! Volunteers are needed to visit with the senior, and help them care for their pet. The volunteers might walk a dog, clean a litter box, pick up pet food or litter, take a pet to the vet and/or foster a pet if the senior becomes hospitalized. We are looking for volunteers to do some or all of these things. Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. We only ask for one hour per week (or more if YOU chose)! Many seniors want to play cards or games and go for walks. This is a great way to make a difference in someone's life and their pets life! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers areas of Western Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit home bound elderly for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and Amie's Place Foundation and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule and is located (ideally) within 30 minutes of your home or office.

11104.description: About: For many families, the Social Adult Day Program offers a welcome alternative to a nursing home. Seniors can remain living in their homes, and caregivers can make time for their careers, for other family members, or for themselves. As a volunteer, under the direction of program staff you will be assisting with seniors activities and meal times. The welcoming and home-like center includes a kitchen, a dining area, and activity room. Our highly qualified staff can assist with medication reminders, personal care, and grooming. A low staff-to-participant ratio enables us to offer each senior individualized assistance as needed. Activities include: Therapeutic music, art, and dance sessions Sensory activities Storytelling Gentle exercises Reminiscence groups Arts and crafts The program serves a hot, nutritious lunch each day. We also offer door-to-door transportation in a van that is accessible to people in wheelchairs and people with limited mobility. Requirements: Make at least a 3-month commitment Must have a medical clearance and an up-to-date (within 2 years) PPD test Choose you day/s, Mondays through Fridays; hours are set, 10am to 3pm Qualities: Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitivity to diverse cultures Be caring, considerate, compassionate, patient
11104.title: Adult Day Services for Seniors Volunteer

11104.description: Good day and thanks for reading! Senior CHAT volunteers needed to call and talk with a senior once a week (or more if you choose)! If you don't have the time to visit someone, but would still like to connect and make a new friend, I'd love to hear from you! You would call on your own schedule, whatever works for you! Volunteers must initially meet with me at my office in Sunnyside Queens and commit to calling someone once per week for at least 6 months! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers all areas of Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule! If you are interested in volunteering, please contact Erin Neubauer-Keyes, Friendly Visitor Program Coordinator at Sunnyside Community Services, 43-31 39 Street, Sunnyside, NY 11104. 718-784-6173 x479 Please write \"CHAT VOLUNTEER\" in the subject line of your email. I get a LOT of spam! Thanks!
